description: A gigantic white whirlpool that resembles a dragon and appears without warning on the sea floor near the entrance to the New World. Ships caught in it are generally found days later in waters incredibly far away with no crew left on board.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Caught in White Strom
keyEvents.description: The Thousand Sunny is pulled into the White Strom due to the extra weight of the massive fish they caught. The crew faces imminent danger as the whirlpool threatens to destroy their ship.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces one of the New World's natural dangers and creates a life-threatening situation that requires the intervention of Island Whales to escape.

statusHistory.reason: Natural phenomenon that continues to exist as a hazard

description: The second half of the Grand Line, known as the strongest and most dangerous sea in the world. It features extreme weather conditions, powerful pirates, and treacherous waters. Upon arrival, the Straw Hats witness red seas that resemble flames and turbulent conditions.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hat Pirates Arrive in the New World
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates officially enter the New World, emerging from the depths to witness turbulent red seas. The crew describes it as a sea of flames and the entrance to hell, while Luffy declares it perfect.
keyEvents.significance: Marks a major milestone in the Straw Hats' journey as they enter the second half of the Grand Line where the strongest pirates compete for the title of Pirate King.

statusHistory.reason: The Straw Hats have now entered this region

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' second ship, built by Franky using treasure tree Adam. In this episode, it serves as the setting for the crew's deep-sea fishing adventure and their journey into the New World.

keyEvents.title: Deep Sea Fishing on the Thousand Sunny
keyEvents.description: The crew uses the Thousand Sunny as a base for their deep-sea fishing competition as they travel through the depths toward the New World.
keyEvents.significance: Showcases the ship's capabilities and serves as the setting for the crew's activities.

keyEvents.title: Thousand Sunny Caught in White Strom
keyEvents.description: The ship gets pulled into the dangerous White Strom whirlpool, testing its durability and the crew's ability to handle New World dangers.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the ship's resilience in facing New World hazards.

keyEvents.title: Thousand Sunny Carried by Island Whales
keyEvents.description: The ship is carried to the surface of the New World on the back of an Island Whale after Brook plays Binks' Sake.
keyEvents.significance: Shows an unusual method of travel and the ship's first arrival in the New World proper.

statusHistory.reason: Ship continues to serve the Straw Hat Pirates
